title: Loch Pityoulish Walking Route

images.title: Nick Forwood / Loch Pityoulish 2
images.caption: Loch Pityoulish. A faint track runs along the shore of this tranquil lochside right next to the shore.

images.title: Jim Bain / Loch Pityoulish
images.caption: View up the loch from the north shore.

images.title: Jim Bain / Near Loch Pityoulish
images.caption: Heathland by Loch Pityoulish. A mix of heather broom and whins with birch and other stuff. The V notch in the far distance is the Lairig Ghru one of the major passes through the mountains of the central Highlands.

description: This pretty loch is located just to the east of Aviemore in the Cairngorms. You can follow a track along the lochside and enjoy fine views over the water to the surrounding woodland. It's a very peaceful and picturesque little spot with lovely views to the Cairngorms Mountains in the distance.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head south east and you can enjoy another lochside walk around the beautiful Loch Morlich. It's a more popular area with a 4 mile track running around the lake. Near Kincraig there's Loch Insh which includes a watersports centre and an old lochside church. Just west of Aviemore there's the wonderful Craigellachie Nature Reserve. The reserve includes a series of lochans, fascinating plantlife and a wonderful viewpoint towards the nearby Cairn Gorm. For more walking ideas in the area see the Cairngorms Walks page.

display_address: B970, Aviemore, Highland, Alba / Scotland, PH24 3BS, United Kingdom
